vcontact package¶

Subpackages¶

Submodules¶

vcontact.associations module¶

Functions to build the associations between the objects from the matrices.

vcontact.associations.cluster_taxonomy(clusters, taxonomy, level, P, R)[source]¶

Add the associations to the cluster and taxonomy dataframes. Using the maximum of precision taxonomic class of each cluster and the maximum of recall cluster of each taxonomic class. If this maximum is null, the position is set to NaN.

Parameters:
  • clusters (dataframe) – to modify
  • taxonomy (dataframe) – to modify
  • level (str) – taxonomic level of P & R
  • P (sparse_matrix) – Precision matrix (cluster X taxonomic class)
  • R (sparse_matrix) – Recall matrix (cluster X taxonomic class)
Returns:

(dataframe,dataframe): dataframe clusters with added columns “pos_level” and “precision_level” and dataframe taxonomy with added columns “pos_cluster” and “recall”.
vcontact.associations.contig_cluster(contigs, B)[source]¶

Associate each contig with its maximal-membership cluster. If the maximal-membership is null, the mbship cluster position is set to NaN.

Parameters:
  • contigs (dataframe) – the contigs, with: pos: the position of the contig in the matrix.
  • B (sparse_matrix) – Membership matrix
Returns:

contigs with pos_cluster_mbship column added.
Return type:

dataframe
vcontact.associations.contig_taxonomy(contigs, taxonomy, clusters, level, cluster_choice='pos_cluster_mbship')[source]¶

Associate each contig with its predicted taxonomic class

Parameters:
  • contigs (dataframe) – the contigs, with a “cluster_choice” column.
  • taxonomy (dataframe) – names of the taxonomic classes at this level.
  • level (str) – taxonomic level
  • clustering_choice (str) – column in which the cluster of a contig can be found.
Returns:

contigs with “predicted_level” column added.
Return type:

dataframe

vcontact.genome_clusters module¶

Genome clusters : An object to work on the similarity network and make the affiliations

class vcontact.genome_clusters.GenomeCluster(pcm, inflation=2, threshold=None, name=None, membership_simple=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Deal with the clusters of the contig similarity network

features¶

(pandas df) Protein clusters

(pandas df) Contigs & Reference genomes

network¶

(sparse matrix) Contig similarity network

taxonomy¶

(pandas df) Taxonomic class

clusters¶

(pandas df) Contig clusters

mcl_results¶

(list of list) mcl_result[cluster][prot]

Init the object with a pc-profile object and perform the clustering

Parameters:
  • pcm – PCMatrix object or a tuple (features (df), contigs (df), network (sparse matrix)).
  • inflation (float) – inflation for mcl.
  • threshold (float) – minimal significativity.
  • name (str) – A name to identify the object.
  • membership_simple (bool) – if false use non boolean membership.

load_clusters(fi)[source]¶

Load clusters from the mcl results

Parameters:fi (str) – path to the MCL result file.
Returns:df – give for each contig cluster
its name, size and position in the matrix.
Return type:pandas.DataFrame
Side-Effect:
Modify self.contig to add the column “pos_cluster” giving the pos of the cluster it belongs to.

The file fi was probably generated using : “mcl <file>.ntw –abc -I 2 -o <file>.clusters”.

Routine of the analysis using all the dataset.

Parameters:levels (tuple) – Taxonomic levels to consider.
Returns:Classification metrics. One line by taxonomic level.
Return type:dataframe

Warning

This function modify directly the attributes of the object.

cross_validation_affiliation(level='family', folds=10)[source]¶

Cross validation affiliation.

Cut the dataset (where a reference taxonomy exist) into <fold> equal parts and use alternativly <fold-2> of them to do the affiliation. Compute the classification metrics on the learning set and on the two remaining sets: cross validation (used to select the model) and test (used to have an unbiased estimate of the error of the classification.)

Note

The splitting is stratified to keep the relative taxonomic classes in the same proportions in each fold.

Parameters:
  • level (str) – Taxonomic level to consider.
  • folds (int) – number of folds for the cross-validation.
Returns:

Dict of dataframes, one entry by set (learning,cv,test). In the dataframes are the classification metrics, one row by selected cv-set.
Return type:

dict
learning_curve_affiliation(level='family', folds=10)[source]¶

Learning curve affiliation.

Cut the dataset (where a reference taxonomy exist) into <fold> equal parts and increasingly one to <fold-1> of them to do the affiliation. Compute the classification metrics on the learning set and on a randomly picked cross validation set in the non used subset.

Note

The splitting is stratified to keep the relative taxonomic classes in the same proportions in each fold.

Parameters:
  • levels (str) – Taxonomic level to consider.
  • folds (int) – number of folds for the cross-validation.
Returns:

Dict of dict of dataframes, one entrie by level then one entry by set (learning,cv). In the dataframes are the classification metrics), one row by learning set size .
Return type:

dict

vcontact.genomes.pid(prot)[source]¶

vcontact.matrices module¶

Matrices used to compare the reference taxonomy with the clustering results.

B: Membership matrix.
B[g,c]: proportion of edges weight linking node g to nodes in c.
K: Reference membership matrix.
K[g,t]: (bool) node g belongs to taxonomic class t.
Q: Correspondance matrix.
Q[c,t]: Sum for the sequence of class t of the membership to the clusters c.
R: Recall matrix.
R[c,t]: Proportion of (Q affiliated to t) that belongs to c.
P: Precision matrix.
P[c,t]: Proportion of (Q in cluster c) that is affiliated to t.
F: F-measure matrix.
F[c,t]: (2PR)/(P+R)
vcontact.matrices.membership(mcl_results, network, nodes)[source]¶

Membership matrix of the node to the clusters.

Parameters:
  • mcl_results – (list of list) a list of nodes name by cluster. Extracted from the lines of the mcl output.
  • network – (sparse matrix) similarity network.
  • nodes – (dataframe) with a column “name” corresponding to the entries in mcl_results and a column “pos” corresponding to the position in the matrix.
Returns:

B, Membership matrix #node X #clusters, B(g,c) is the proportion of edges weight linking the node g to the cluster C
Return type:

sparse_matrix

Membership matrix of the node to the clusters.

Parameters:contigs (dataframe) – with column pos and pos_cluster
Returns:B, Membership matrix #node X #clusters, B(g,c) = bool(g in c)
Return type:sparse_matrix

  • taxonomy – (dataframe) with columns: name: name of the class (str). pos: position in matrix (int).
  • condition – (str) a query to filter the contig dataframe.
Returns:

K, Bool(K[c,t]) == Contig c is of class t.
Return type:

Build the (cluster X taxonomic class) correspondances matrix.

Parameters:
  • K (sparse matrix) – Reference membership matrix.
  • B (sparse matrix) – Membership matrix.
Returns:

(tuple of sparse_matrix): including Q: Correspondance matrix R: Recall (or coverage) P: Precision F: F-measure 2PR/(P+R)

vcontact.matrices.link_clusters(network, contigs, col_cluster='pos_cluster')[source]¶

Link the clusters

Parameters:
  • network (sparse-matrix) – similarity network.
  • contigs (dataframe) – with columns pos (position in the matrix) and “col_cluster” (cluster of the contig).
  • col_cluster (str) – column to use in “contigs”.
Returns:

sparse-matrix: Contig cluster network, edge weight is inter over intra total similarity.

vcontact.ml_functions module¶

Machine learning functions - Some helper functions from ML

vcontact.ml_functions.split_dataset(dataset, criterion, fold)[source]¶

Split the dataset in <fold> startified parts to use as training and cross validation test. Stratified means that the proportions of criterion in the original dataset are conserved as much as possible in the subsets.

Parameters:
  • dataset – (dataframe) the data.
  • fold – (int) number of parts in which to split the dataset.
  • criterion – (str) column on which perform the stratification.
Returns:

with the column “cvset_criterion” (int) in [0-fold-1] added. gives the id of the set this contig belong to. Set to nan to the contigs that do not meet the criterion.
Return type:

dataset
vcontact.ml_functions.classification_metrics(dataset, ref_col='reference', pred_col='predicted')[source]¶

Returns a series of metric given a classification.

The metrics are “macro-averaged”, which means that we take the average of metric between the classes. As a consequence each class as the same wieght in the final result regardless of its size.

Non affiliated references (NaN) are dropped.

Predicted classes absent from the references or that are not defined (NaN) are counting as negative prediction for all classess (and thus dispatched between True and False negatives).

By convention if the divider is null the metric is null.

Parameters:dataset (pandas.DataFrame) – one row by entry. reference: the reference classification of the entry predicted: the predicted classification of the entry
ref_col (str): column where the reference classes are.
pred_col (str): column where the predicted classes are.
Returns:A dictionary including: entries: number of entries. reference_entries: number of entries with a reference class. reference_classes: number of different classes. (used for
the macro averaging).

common_classes: number of classes found in reference and prediction. classified_entries: number of entries with a predicted class. classified_classes: number of different predicted classes. recall: TP/(TP+FN) (positive effectively predicted as positive).

(a.k.a, sensitivity, power or 1-type II error).
precision: TP/(TP+FP) (predicted positive effectively positive).
(a.k.a. positive predictive value).
specificity: TN/(FP+FN) negative effectively predicted as negative.
(a.k.a 1-type I error)

fmeasure: 2PR/(P+R) harmonic mean of precision and recall.
Return type:dict

define_modules(matrix, I=5)[source]¶

Save the pc network in a file ready for MCL Run MCL Load clusters from the mcl results

Parameters:
  • matrix – (scipy.sparse matrix) network.
  • fi – (str) filename.
  • I – (float) Inflation for mcl.
Returns:

A dataframe containing: name: the name of the module. size: the number of protein clusters in the module. pos: the position of the module in the matrix. proteins: the number of proteins in the module. annotated_proteins: the number of annotated proteins in the module.
Side-Effects:
self.features: Add the column “module”.
Saved Files:
name.ntwk: The pc similarity network. name_mcl_I.clusters: mcl results. name_mcl_I_modules.pandas: the module dataframe. name_mcl_I_features.pandas: the pc dataframe.
module_in_contigs(matrix=None, contigs=None, modules=None)[source]¶

Compute the presence of modules in each contig

Parameters:
  • matrix (scipy.sparse) – , M[contigs,pc] = “pc in contig” (bool)
  • modules (pandas.DataFrame) – with columns : pos,
Returns:

S, S[contig,module] = proportions of module’s pcs present in contig (in [0,1])
Return type:

matrix
link_modules_and_clusters(clusters, contigs, modules, matrix_modules, thres, own_threshold)[source]¶

Link the modules with the contigs clusters using the hypergeometric formula.

bool(M[contig,module]>=own_threshold): module is present in contig
Parameters:
  • modules (pandas.DataFrame) – information about the protein modules
  • clusters (pandas.DataFrame) – information about the contig clusters
  • contigs (pandas.DataFrame) – information about the contigs
  • thres – (float) significativity threshold.
  • own_threshold – minimal proportion of PCs to “own” the module.
Returns:

S (scipy.sparse) S[module,cluster] = sig.
Formula:
P(X>=c) ~ H(n,a,b)
c: number of contigs in cluster c owning module m. n: number of contigs. a: number of contigs in the cluster c. b: number of contigs owning module m.
link_modules_and_clusters_df(clusters, contigs, modules=None, matrix_module=None, thres=1, own_threshold=0.7)[source]¶

Returns the dataframe giving the association between clusters and modules

bool(M[contig,module]>=own_threshold): module is present in contig
Parameters:
  • modules (pandas.DataFrame) – information about the protein modules
  • clusters (pandas.DataFrame) – information about the contig clusters
  • contigs (pandas.DataFrame) – information about the contigs
  • thres – (float) significativity threshold.
  • own_threshold – minimal proportion of PCs to “own” the module.
Returns:

A dataframe containing the position of the module, of the cluster, the significativity of the association and merged with the lines from modules and clusters..

vcontact.pc_matrix module¶

Object containing th pc-profiles of the contigs and able to compute the similarity network on the contigs and the pcs.

index : name, family, genus, origin

load_profiles(ref_proteins, cluster_proteins)[source]¶

Load a Protein cluster presence/absence matrix.

INPUT: ref_proteins = pandas dataframe with:

index : protein_id, contig, function
cluster_proteins = pandas dataframe with :
index : protein_id, cluster

OUTPUT: - matrix (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) contigs x protein_clusters.

M(c,p) = Bool(“Contig c has the PC p”)
network(matrix, singletons, thres=1)[source]¶

Compute the hypergeometric-similarity contig network.

M(c,p) == True <-> PC p is in Contig c.
Parameters:thres (float) – Minimal significativity to store an edge value.
Returns:scipy.sparse: S symmetric lil matrix, contigs x contigs. S(c,c) = sig(link)
network_modules(matrix=None, thres=1)[source]¶

Compute the hypergeometric-similarity pc network.

Warning

Use only the PCs that are present in 3 contigs or more.

Parameters:
  • matrix (scipy.sparse) – contigs x protein clusters : M(c,p) == True <-> PC p is in Contig c.
  • thres (float) – Minimal significativity to store an edge value.
Returns:

scipy.sparse: Symmetric lil_matrix, PCs x PCs S(c,c) = sig(link)
nodes_properties(matrix)[source]¶

Compute several node specific statistics.

Parameters:matrix – (sparse.matrix) contig-similaritt network
Side-effect:
self.contigs: Add the following columns:

degree: Number of edge to the node. clustering_coefficient: Proportion of existing edges

over possible edges in the neighborhood of the node
betweeness_centrality: sum of the fraction of all-pairs
shortest path that pass trhough the node.
